description: From French cornéule, from New Latin corneola, diminutive of cornea. By surface analysis, cornea +‎ ule.

entries.meaning: (zoology) One of the corneas of a compound eye in the invertebrates.
examples: Behind each “corneule" is a layer of dark pigment, which takes the place, and serves the purpose, of the “iris” in the eyes of Vertebrate animals.
